posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Only me with another question.

I understand DR in essence, I hope, but remain unclear how things like Soak Damage impact upon it. For example, I'm currently testing a build who's presently wearing armour that soaks 5 bludgeoning damage, and has a shield that gives 5/+2 DR. I appreciate that the one soaks the first 5 points of all bludgeoning damage, while the other resists the first 5 points of damage from up to +2 weapons, but does the one cancel out the other, or do they stack? And what's applied first - Resistance or Soak? I looked on the wiki, and felt no better I'm afraid.

It's one of those things that's bugged me over time, but I've only just got round to asking for knowledge - soz!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: I found the answer on this page: http://nwn.wikia.com/wiki/Damage_reduction and they explain it better than I would.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Brilliant, Empyre - thanks. Don't know how that page skipped me by - I did look, I promise! It also helped with my misapprehension that (eg) DR 20/+3 included +3 weapons, whereas it's actually up to but not including +3.

Feeling much better now, thanks for digging up the link.
